result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Trevino-Singstock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With Huber for treatment and medical/dental appointments. May also have huber for Job search. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.
Consecutive to: 15CT345.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob R Trevino-Singstock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Jacob R Trevion-Singstock in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Michael Patrick White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter was scheduled for plea and sentencing today.
State has extended a global offer.
Def is requesting a 45 day adjournment.
Deft is in treatment.
Deft has been in compliance with ZCI.
Def would like deft to be further along in treatment.
State does not object.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob R Trevion-Singstock in court with attorney Mindy Nolan for Trisha Janet Fritz.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def has provided the Court documentation that the deft continues treatment.
State has extended a global offer.
Def moves to modify conditions of bond to remove the SCRAM unit in 15CM2332.
State does not object to the removal of SCRAM.
State indicates that substantial treatment would need to be completed.
Def would request a date into January.
State indicates if the deft does not change his plea at the next date, they will be asking for a Jury trial.
BTC: Matter adjourned, Modify conditions of bond in case 15CM2332 to remove the SCRAM unit, deft to continue testing after each court appearance, and modify to add that the deft must be tested weekly.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***11-9-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE THE SCRAM UNIT. DEFT MUST BE TESTED RANDOMLY AND AFTER EACH COURT APPEARANCE.*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  No contact with the victim, DAS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Status conference at 11-09-2015 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 11-12-2015 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  No contact with the victim, DAS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jacob R Trevino-Singstock in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Jacob R Trevino-Singstock in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.   Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
